thread.title: Why Oklahoma Has The Most Women Per Capita in Prison

author: Elizabeth Winkler
title: Why Oklahoma Has The Most Women Per Capita in Prison
text:
Oklahoma incarcerates more women per capita than any other state—about 151 out of every 100,000 women, double the national average.
The total prison population, including men, reached 28,850 in June 2016, according to an official report.
Voters passed two measures aimed at effecting change, and both went into effect in July despite lawmakers’... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
